text: Is there an eslint config for Hubl?

Not exactly sure what you mean by this, but I think the closest we have is the <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-vscode> extension for VSCode that gives syntax highlighting, autocomplete, etc for HubL (but I don’t think it does much in terms of lint-style errors and warnings).
is there any recommended way to prevent a page from jumping up and down when different numbers of search results are returned to an element that is scrolled down the page? Is it a virtual list?

Hello, I am trying to get started with the local development for the hello-world-app for the react beta. I've uploaded the theme to my portal without issue, but when I try to view it locally on <http://hslocal.net:3000/>, it just says "This site can't be reached". My terminal doesn't report any issue:

`\react-test\cms-js-building-block-examples\hello-world>npm run start`

`> start`
`> cd hello-world-project/hello-world-app && yarpm start`


`> hello-world-app@0.1.0 start`
`> hs-cms-dev-server .`

`Warning: this is a prerelease and requires specific HubSpot account configuration to work`
`Starting proxy link server on port 1442`

`HubSpot CMS dev server hosting: hello-world-project/hello-world-app (at <http://hslocal.net:3000>, hubid=55555555)`

Does anyone have any idea what could be the issue?

Yep, looks like it works on localhost, thanks!

The preview of a live page (Step 5 <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-block-examples/blob/main/hello-world/README.md|the documentation>), still doesn't work though because that uses <http://hslocal.net|hslocal.net>
I’m walking from my phone, but could be worth it if someone from HS has the time to help debug with nslookup/whatever OS dns lookup tool…
in the meantime <@U05HME735S7> you should be able to swap in `localhost` for `<http://hslocal.net|hslocal.net>` in any further steps
Hey Andrey, this should be fixed now, let me know if you try it again soon
